fields.title:
Hello again! ðŸ˜€
We hope you are doing well. We would like to continue our survey designed to evaluate a COVID-19 vaccination social media campaign in Nigeria. Your voice and views are very important to help improve the nation's health and well-being. Your friends, your community, and your country appreciate your willingness to participate in this important research.

If you complete this survey, you will receive 400 Naira in mobile credit. We know you are busy, so this will only take approximately 15 minutes.

Do you accept to participate in the survey?

We would like to begin by asking some questions about vaccination against COVID-19. 

Keep in mind that your answers will remain confidential.

Have you received a COVID-19 vaccine?	

- A. Yes, a single dose vaccine
- B. Yes, the first dose of a two-dose regimen
- C. Yes, both doses of a two-dose regimen 
- D. No
In which YEAR did you receive your COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which MONTH did you receive your COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which DAY did you receive your COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which YEAR did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which MONTH did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which DAY did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which YEAR did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which MONTH did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which DAY did you receive your first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which YEAR did you receive your second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which MONTH did you receive your second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]
In which DAY did you receive your second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine? [Please enter a number]

Would you take a COVID-19 vaccine that is approved for use in Nigeria if offered to you?

- A. Definitely
- B. Probably
- C. I may or I may not
- D. Probably not
- E. Definitely not
- F. Donâ€™t know

If there is a COVID-19 vaccine availableâ€¦	

- A. I will want to get it as soon as possible
- B. I will take it when offered
- C. Iâ€™m not sure what I will do
- D. I will put off (delay) getting it
- E. I will refuse to get it
- F. Donâ€™t know

I would describe my attitude towards receiving a COVID-19 vaccine asâ€¦	

- A. Very keen
- B. Pretty positive
- C. Neutral
- D. Quite uneasy
- E. Against it
- F. Donâ€™t know

If a COVID-19 vaccine was available at my local pharmacy, I wouldâ€¦	

- A. Get it as soon as possible
- B. Get it when I have time
- C. Delay getting it
- D. Avoid getting it for as long as possible
- E. Never get it
- F. Donâ€™t know

If my family or friends were thinking of getting a COVID-19 vaccination, I wouldâ€¦	

- A. Strongly encourage them
- B. Encourage them
- C. Not say anything to them about it
- D. Ask them to delay getting the vaccination
- E. Suggest that they do not get the vaccination
- F. Donâ€™t know

I would describe myself asâ€¦

- A. Eager to get the COVID-19 vaccine
- B. Willing to get the COVID-19 vaccine
- C. Not bothered about getting the COVID-19 vaccine
- D. Unwilling to get the COVID-19 vaccine
- E. Anti-vaccination for COVID-19
- F. Donâ€™t know

Taking a COVID-19 vaccination isâ€¦	

- A. Really important
- B. Important
- C. Neither important nor unimportant
- D. Unimportant
- E. Really unimportant
- F. Donâ€™t know"

How easy or difficult is it to get the COVID-19 vaccination for yourself? Would you say it is:

- A. Very difficult
- B.Â A bit difficult
- C. Quite easy
- D.Â Very easy
- E.Â Donâ€™t know/Canâ€™t say
Now, we would like to ask some question about your opinion on COVID-19 vaccination.

I am confident that COVID-19 vaccines are safe and effective.	

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

Vaccination against COVID-19 is unnecessary.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

Everyday stress prevents me from getting a COVID-19 vaccine.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

When I think about getting vaccinated against COVID-19, I weigh the benefits and risks to make the best decision possible.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

When everyone is vaccinated against COVID-19, I donâ€™t have to get vaccinated too.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

Please hold on! Only 20 questions are left.

Now we would like to ask you some questions about your beliefs about vaccination. 

Keep in mind that your answers will remain confidential.

Your friends think it is important for everyone to get a COVID-19 vaccine.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

Your family members think it is important for everyone to get a COVID-19 vaccine.

- A. Strongly disagree
- B. Disagree
- C. Neither agree nor disagree
- D. Agree
- E. Strongly agree

Of the people close to you, what proportion of them would want you to get the COVID-19 vaccine?	

- A. A few (1-20%)
- B. Some (21-40%)
- C. Many (41-60%)
- D. Most (61-80%)
- E. Nearly all or all (81-100%)

How many people in Nigeria do you think will get the COVID-19 vaccine when it becomes available?	

- A. A few (1-20%)
- B. Some (21-40%)
- C. Many (41-60%)
- D. Most (61-80%)
- E. Nearly all or all (81-100%)

How many people who work in healthcare in Nigeria do you think will get the COVID-19 vaccine when it becomes available?

- A. A few (1-20%)
- B. Some (21-40%)
- C. Many (41-60%)
- D. Most (61-80%)
- E. Nearly all or all (81-100%)

IN THE PAST WEEK, have you seen any information about COVID-19 vaccine on social media platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp, YouTube, or Twitter?	

- A. Yes
- B. No, I didnâ€™t use social media
- C. No, used social media but didnâ€™t see anything about COVID-19
- D. Donâ€™t remember

Did you like or share or comment on any of these COVID-19 vaccine related posts on social media platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp, YouTube, or Twitter?	

- A. Yes
- B. No
- C. Donâ€™t remember
Do you trust the information about COVID-19 vaccine that you get from social media platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp, YouTube, or Twitter?

IN THE PAST WEEK, have you seen any information about COVID-19 vaccine on traditional media such as television, radio, or newspapers?	

- A. Yes
- B. No, I didnâ€™t use traditional media
- C. No, I used traditional media but didnâ€™t see anything about COVID-19
- D. Donâ€™t remember
Do you trust the information about COVID-19 vaccine that you get from traditional media such as television, radio, or newspapers?

Please hold on! Only 10 questions are left.

Now, we would like to ask some question about your awareness and experience with managing COVID-19. 

Keep in mind that your answers will remain confidential.
To your knowledge, have you been infected with COVID-19?

How concerned are you about getting infected with COVID-19?

- A. Not at all concerned
- B. A little concerned
- C. Moderately concerned
- D. Very concerned"
Do you have a chronic health risks like diabetes, high blood pressure, overweight by more than 15 Kg, or other health conditions that make it riskier for you if you get COVID?

How important do you think masks are for slowing the spread of COVID-19?

- A. Not at all important
- B. Slightly important
- C. Moderately important
- D. Extremely important

Which of these sources do you trust the most to get information on COVID-19? [SELECT ONE ONLY]

- A. Radio
- B. TV
- C. Newspaper
- D. Online Social Media
- E. Friends or family
- F. Clergy/Religious leaders
- G. Colleagues in the healthcare profession 
- H. Nigerian Centers for Disease Control 
- I. NPHCDA
- J. State health ministry
- K. International Organizations like CDC, WHO

What is your gender?

- A. Woman
- B. Man
- C. Prefer not to say

How old are you?

- A. Under 18 years
- B. 18-29 
- C. 30-39 
- D. 40-49 
- E. 50-59 
- F. 60+ years

What is your religion?

- A. Catholic
- B. Other Christian
- C. Islam
- D. Traditionalist
- E. Other

Thank you very much!

Your participation provides valuable insights for all of us to react appropriately in the current COVID-19 situation and to reach all citizens with useful information in a timely manner.

You are eligible to receive 400 Naira in mobile credit. We will send the credit to your mobile.
Please write a mobile number where we can send mobile credit:
Which mobile operator is associated with that number?
Thank you. You should receive the credit shortly. We will write to you again when the payment has been accepted by your mobile operator.

We are sorry, but we could not add credit to the number {{field:mobile}}. The transaction failed with the following message:
{{hidden:e_payment_reloadly_error_message}}
We need a number associated with a valid prepaid account to send you credit. Sorry for the inconvenience. Please, try again with another number.
Good news! The payment has been accepted by your mobile operator. You should receive the credit soon.

Thank you for your time! 
We will contact you again in the next few months to ask you some more questions. 

If you answer our questions you will get an additional 400 Naira in mobile credit.
We will get in touch soon!

Hello again! ðŸ˜€
We hope you are doing well. We would like to continue our survey designed to evaluate a COVID-19 vaccination social media campaign in Nigeria. Your voice and views are very important to help improve the nation's health and well-being. Your friends, your community, and your country appreciate your willingness to participate in this important research.

If you complete this survey, you will receive 400 Naira in mobile credit. We know you are busy, so this will only take approximately 15 minutes.

Do you accept to participate in the survey?
Thank you!
